sub_title: Business Development Director North West Europe at Clariter
summary:
★The most important question in innovation is not whether the technology will work, but whether it matters?★

As a tech enthusiast, I am deeply impressed every day by the creativity and genius of the solutions I come across. Although I do not know much about chemistry, and physics was not my strong suit in high school, I do understand a thing or two about business development and finance. And that is exactly the sweet spot I am in: helping clean tech innovators turn their great ideas into realistic and fundable business opportunities that have an impact on society. From May 2020, I started a new challenge as business development director NWE for Clariter. Clariter's revolutionary chemical upcycling technology ends the life of plastics by converting them into high-quality alyphatic solvents, mineral oils and paraffin waxes. 

Our unique process transforms more than 60% of all plastic waste types into 3 high-value industrial products: solvents, oils, and waxes. These go on to become more than 1000 everyday end products. Now, rather than using recycled plastic, we can all enjoy upcycled plastic-free products.

Together, we’re pro-actively cleaning the planet of plastic waste, creating environment-friendly, fossil-free products, and empowering industry to meet sustainability regulations, reduce carbon footprint, create jobs, and build stronger communities.

location.short: Nieuwerkerk aan den IJssel, South Holland

projects.title: Development regional investment fund Dutch earthquake area | Ex-ante evaluation
projects.description:
In order to meet the financial needs of entrepreneurs in the province of Groningen specifically those within the region which is being hit by earthquakes, a tailored €100 million investment fund is being developed by ERAC. 
Making sure the needs are properly investigated among those entrepreneurs is the assignment which my team is currently working on. Our input is vital to the development of the strategy of the Investment fund.

contributors.headline: Business Development Director North West Europe at Clariter
Strategisch adviseur | Bestuur- en Managmentadvisering | Veiligheidsregio & Brandweer | Overheidsmanagement
Adviseur bij ERAC (European and Regional Affairs Consultants)

projects.title: Project development Dutch egg farming value chain
projects.description:
Most farmers face financial difficulties due unequal income balance within the value chain.  
The goal of this project is to optimize the value for consumption of eggs in such a way that a start is made with a fair distribution of income, based on the value added by each participant. 
The ultimate goal here is to ensure the survival of the poultry sector and to prevent the Netherlands from becoming a net-importer instead of a net-exporter of consumption eggs. Within this project a combination of high-end robotics, software, online applications are being combined with the latest insights in business model development. A unique collaboration between farmers, technical suppliers, innovators, universities and governmental bodies will bring this project to reality. 

Together with my team at ERAC I contributed to the design and development of this project. Based on the distress within the market combined with the latest technology and business model solutions we presented a turnkey project, which will tilt the balance. This project is being financed by both the partners and the regional government.

contributors.headline: Business Development Director North West Europe at Clariter
Interim subsidieprofessional, beschikbaar als subsidiecoördinator en subsidieadviseur (bereikbaar via jan@tradujean.nl)

projects.title: Financial engineering innovative farming concept NL/Brabant
projects.description:
Developing an economically sustainable pig farm where the animals' welfare is central, that is the goal of Big Developments. By bringing together of separate developments, such as a vacuum toilet and an animal tracking system, a revolutionary innovation will be created that will improve the social climate in the stable considerably.

Last year, a pig farmer, subcontractors, a construction company, a system innovator, various research institutes and high-tech companies along the project Big Developments developed. Frank Wind and Tjacko Sijpkens with their company Zero Gravity Movement, the directors of this process. Sijpkens: "The involvement of all links in the chain from the base, we can develop an innovative concept for the sustainable keeping pigs. A vacuum toilet is just one of the many improvements which can be made. Long term storage of manure in the barn no longer need this. "There are already a lot of ideas on the drawing board. Intensive to sustainable pig farming, which is truly a Big Development! This project is made possible with support from OPZuid, province of North Brabant, the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Agrifood Capital.

Client request
Bringing the inspiring idea to a realistic project was clear to the team of Big Developments. But how do you arrive at a good (public) financing strategy? Together with my team we have developed a project design that fits within the call of EFRO OPZuid, the European funding program for the provinces of Zeeland, Limburg and Noord-Brabant. Combined with a separate financial contribution by the province this revolutionary project will be realized in the next three years. 

Impact
ERAC has contributed to positioning the realization of 'sustainable stable project with the concept as an open innovation platform, which other researchers (SME) businesses are given the opportunity to test additional innovations. In short, impact in the chain.

authors.headline: Business Development Director North West Europe at Clariter

profile_positions.description: Clariter is a clean-tech innovation company with representatives on 4 continents. Our unique process transforms more than 60% of all plastic waste types into 3 high-value industrial products: solvents, oils, and waxes. With an international team of specialist I am responsible for realizing the first full scale commercial plants in North West Europe.
profile_positions.title: Business Development Manager North West Europe

profile_positions.description:
ERAC Innovation: "a faster way to certainty"

As managing partner at ERAC Innovation I lead our Growth Engineering Team that focuses on delivering blended finance solutions for 1st of a kind technical demonstration projects in clean tech. Because of their technical uncertainty these projects are usually fairly complex to fund. With our team of financial and regional economic experts we are able to construct the most optimal public-private financial partnership that turns solutions into tangible impact. 

For me these partnerships are a contribution to a  better climate and the future competitiveness of regions, something our company feels strongly committed to help strengthen.

Keywords: #Public - Private Partnership #Blended_Finance #Sustainability #Cleantech #Energy
#Regions
profile_positions.title: Managing Partner

profile_positions.description: The Defence Innovation Greenhouse is a non-profit innovation, collaboration and best practices center serving public sector crisis responders. It is clear that we're stronger when we work together, which is why we are building a world class facility where multinational teams can collaborate to use the latest technologies to solve pressing problems for our crisis responders.
profile_positions.title: Chairman Of The Board

profile_positions.description:
Het LaunchLab is een uniek programma speciaal voor (young) professionals en Wetenschappers met een technisch bedrijfsidee. Het LaunchLab programma bestaat uit de beste start-upmethodes van dit moment. De new entrepreneurs toetsen in drie maanden tijd hun business idee bij relevante stakeholders (klanten, leveranciers en partners) en ontdekken hoe de juiste markt hierin centraal staat. YES!Delft zet daarbij haar netwerk in de Nederlandse en Europese innovatiesector in om te zorgen dat zij met juiste mensen aan tafel zitten. 
Als een van de negen coaches geef ik wekelijks feedback op de voortgang van de ontwikkeling van de businessmodels. De uiteenlopende ideeën en achtergronden van zowel de LaunchLab-participants als de coaches in combinatie met pressure cooker methodiek maken dit programma voor iedereen waardevol.
profile_positions.title: Coach LaunchLab

profile_positions.description:
“de NVAS-subsidie-adviseur maakt het verschil!”

De NVAS heeft als doel de belangen van de professionele subsidieadviseur in de Nederlandse markt te behartigen door de kwaliteit van het vakmanschap te waarborgen, door integer, transparant en onafhankelijk handelen te stimuleren en door een consistente communicatie over het vakgebied en de beroepsgroep te organiseren.
profile_positions.title: Voorzitter

profile_positions.description:
FFIT innovates tomorrow's economy. We improve the innovation performance for our clients at a strategic and operational level. Our consultants are focussed at:
- Lean innovation processing
- Financing innovation
- Business development (PPP) 

The goal is to increase a company's Return on Innovation with a combination of strategic consultancy, coaching, project management and training. 

Our 'down to earth' & result driven approach have already contributed to various achievements such as: 

1. New business funding for an innovative start-up in the automotive industry. Starting as an two-man-show the company has grown to a high-tech 12 person business with a focus on the high-end classic market in EU, US and Japan. Combining public/private finance instruments we have contributed to the realization of their growth.  

2. Development of a business assessment tool for the management board of a medium sized high tech company to evaluate their innovation performance. Combining both hard economic data with soft skill assessment the board was able to monitor and adjust Innovation performance against strategic goals.

3. Business development for a corporate high-end service provider. We contributed in creating a new € 3 million plus business within one year by aligning their capabilities next to a public grand challenge of social innovation in order to increase both productivity as well as employability.
profile_positions.title: Consultant & Owner

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Solar Impulse Foundation has committed to identify 1000 Solutions that can protect the environment in a profitable way, demonstrating to decision-makers that such solutions exist and that they can adopt more ambitious targets, policies and regulations to help bring them to market.

We focus our efforts on five of the Sustainable Development Goals, namely water, energy, industry, sustainable cities, and responsible consumption/production.

I am proud to help the foundation in assessing these solutions according to their technological feasibility, environmental and socio-economic benefits, and potential or realized profitability. Those solutions that meet this criteria will be labelled as Solar Impulse Efficient Solutions, lending them credibility.

YES!Delft is the high tech entrepreneurs centre with a clear mission: Building tomorrow’s leading firms. Yes!Delft inspires students, professionals and scientists to make their first steps on the path to becoming an entrepreneur and they offer them the necessary support to turn their venture into a success. 
I am honored to be part of the enthusiastic Yes!Delft coach team. And so to share my knowledge, expertise and network for the success of the involved incubators.
